The test record contains a single metadata record, three contacts, and two data dictionaries. Record was simplified to:
  - only include a single domain
  - reduce number of data dictionary attributes
  - reduce number of contacts
  - copy data dictionary
  - reduced number of thesauri and keywords
  - simplified lineage","purpose":"To document the effects of sea level rise and climate change on the landscape of Cape Hatteras (Outer Banks, North Carolina). This project will study changes in landscape and habitat as it pertains to the recovery of coastal birds and threatened species in the wake of storms and environmental impacts.","credit":["Kate Spear, U.S. Geological Survey, Wetland Aquatic Research Center."],"timePeriod":{"description":"(Ground Condition) The orthoimagery used for Cape Hatteras NWI photointerpretation was acquired in October 2012, with1-foot ground resolution as part of the Hurricane Sandy project.   The data is 3-band, natural color aerial imagery acquired from the DMC mapping platform.  The data is served on U.S. Geological Surveys' Hazards Data Distribution System (HDDS). Linkage: http://hddsexplorer.usgs.gov/.   Imagery was acquired for North Carolina's Department of transportation.","startDateTime":"2012-02-02","endDateTime":"2012-03-27"},"status":["Complete"],"pointOfContact":[{"party":[{"contactId":"d6c57348-53e8-44c8-beac-9bcc100226c6"}],"role":"pointOfContact"}],"spatialReferenceSystem":[{"referenceSystemParameterSet":{"projection":{"projectionIdentifier":{"identifier":"transverseMercator","name":"NAD 1983 UTM Zone 18N"},"longitudeOfCentralMeridian":-75,"latitudeOfProjectionOrigin":0,"falseEasting":500000,"falseNorthing":0,"falseEastingNorthingUnits":"meter","scaleFactorAtCentralMeridian":0.9996}}},{"referenceSystemParameterSet":{"geodetic":{"datumIdentifier":{"identifier":"D North American 1983","name":"D North American 1983"},"ellipsoidIdentifier":{"identifier":"GRS 1980","name":"GRS 1980"},"semiMajorAxis":6378137,"axisUnits":"meter","denominatorOfFlatteningRatio":298.257222101}}}],"spatialRepresentationType":["vector","coordinate pair"],"spatialRepresentation":[{"vectorRepresentation":{"vectorObject":[{"objectType":"GT-polygon composed of chains","objectCount":2844}]}}],"spatialResolution":[{"coordinateResolution":{"abscissaResolutionX":0.0001,"ordinateResolutionY":0.0001,"unitOfMeasure":"meter"}}],"extent":[{"description":"FGDC spatial domain","geographicExtent":[{"containsData":true,"boundingBox":{"westLongitude":-76.042962,"eastLongitude":-75.437221,"southLatitude":34.998952,"northLatitude":36.000978}}]}],"keyword":[{"keyword":[{"keyword":"Hurricane Sandy"},{"keyword":"Outer Banks"},{"keyword":"Wetlands"}],"keywordType":"theme","thesaurus":{"title":"None","identifier":[{"identifier":"custom"}]}}],"constraint":[{"type":"legal","legal":{"useConstraint":["None"],"accessConstraint":["It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from the U.S. Geological Survey, Wetland Aquatic Research Center and not indirectly through other sources which may have been changed in some way. Polygonal features begin and end at the same point, contain no overshoots or undershoots, and contain a single label. Linear features are continuous where appropriate, i.e., dangling arcs are removed if they are not required."}},{"type":"DQ_CompletenessOmission","descriptiveResult":[{"statement":"For the cartographic process (photointerpretation), habitats were identified and mapped in accordance with nationally accepted mapping standards and conventions.
